noun.description: The state or quality of having opposite surfaces or sides close together.
examples: the thinness of the line between tolerance and blackmail

noun.description: The state or quality of having little, or too little, flesh or fat on the body.
examples: the pitiful thinness of his body

noun.description: The state of having few parts or people relative to the area covered or filled.
The quality of a liquid substance not containing much solid.
examples: the relative thinness of water compared with silicone gel

noun.description: Lack of substance or quality; weakness.
examples: there's enough action to camouflage the thinness of the plot
